Award.AwardTitle: AF: Small: Solving and Simplifying Algebraic, Differential, and Difference Equations.

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Computer & Info Scie & Enginr

Division.LongName: Division of Computing and Communication Foundations

Award.AbstractNarration: Problems in science are often reduced to mathematical equations.<br/>There are many computer programs for solving various types of equations.<br/>The equations themselves often come from computer computation, so they<br/>can be large. This project aims to simplify large equations, reducing them<br/>when possible to smaller ones that can be solved more easily.<br/><br/>When computers construct formulas and equations to tackle problems in science,<br/>their first expressions need not be the simplest ones. It is likely that simpler formulas<br/>or equations exist. Finding them makes subsequent computations easier and faster.<br/>The types of equations that this project aims to simplify are differential equations,<br/>recurrence relations, and algebraic equations in two variables. A common theme for<br/>each of these types of equations is that in order to simplify them, a key step is a<br/>technical analysis of their singularities.<br/><br/>Computer algebra systems can automatically find exact solutions for various types<br/>of equations. They are an important part of the infrastructure for research<br/>and education. However, they often produce unnecessarily complicated answers.<br/>The techniques developed in this project will help to simplify not only equations,<br/>but solutions as well, making them more useful for research and teaching.<br/><br/>This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
